channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This should be replaced like for like - it was a paving slab NOT Tarmac - this is a conservation area, 8th October
item.description:
Outside number 64 Duke Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Duke Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are now 5 streetlights out, 8th October
item.description:
At least 5 streetlights are now out on the north side of Pittville Circus and Pittville Circus Rd between Tresmere and the mini roundabout by the driving test centre. They have been out for at least two weeks. It is very dangerous - the footpath is uneven and there are lots of bushes and dark corners for people to hide in. Please fix this before someone is seriously hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Pittville Circus, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van there last two days in a passing place, 8th October
item.description:
Van in a parking space last two days. Apparently locked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birdlip Road, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees in Green Lane Hucclecote, 8th October
item.description:
I am becoming increasingly concerned about how the vegetation, bushes and tree branches are becoming so overgrown and therefore causing problems in Green Lane just before the junction with Appleton Way (GL3 3RP). When I drive my motorhome before turning into Appleton Way where I live, I have to drive on the wrong side of the road to avoid the tree branches hitting my vehicle. In addition, I think you should be aware that on Monday 13th October, the owner of 50 Appleton Way will be having building work completed at his property which will mean that due to the parking of trades vehicles, the junction of Green Lane/Appleton Way will become quite problematic for local and visiting drivers. Therefore, it would help ease the problem somewhat if the vegetation, bushes and tree branches could be cut back in Green Lane as a matter of urgency .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped supermarket trolley full of bin bags, 8th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drop kerbs/safety/accessibility, 8th October
item.description:
There are no drop kerbs for users of wheel chairs/mobility scooter at the junction of Crescent Place and Royal Crescent/Crescent Terrace. Glos Highways agreed months ago that drops were needed for safety/accessibility, and have visited the site but nothing is happening despite email reminders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Crescent, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 8th October
item.description:
Tree branches are impacting the overhead broadband cables, particularly in high winds, the branches and leaves are impacting the street light next to the tree. Branches are also impacting pedestrians trying to walk down footpath as are now low hanging. This has been requested before but no action taken.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking bay causes congestion, 8th October
item.description:
B4633 Gloucester Road, between junction with Libertus Road and pedestrian crossing (traffic lights). On-street parking bay causes congestion, especially at peak hours, resulting in large amounts of queuing traffic on Gloucester Road and Liberus Road. Traffic flow is much better when there are no vehicles parked at this location. There is short-term free parking ay the railway station - removing the on-street parking at this location would greatly improve traffic flow at peak times, reducing pollution in the process.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 259, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
